item.title: Refinancing with a Mortgage Broker: When It Makes Sense in 2025
item.description:
Refinancing your conventional mortgage through a broker instead of your current lender can save tens of thousands—but only if you understand when broker value outweighs convenience. Here’s how to decide whether to refinance with a broker in 2025.

Why Refinance Through a Broker vs. Your Current Lender?

Your current lender wants to keep your business. They’ll make refinancing easy—but “easy” doesn’t mean “cheapest.”

Current lender advantages:

  • Streamlined process (they already have your information)
  • Fast approvals (no new appraisal required in some cases)
  • Relationship discounts (maybe)

Current lender disadvantages:

item.title: 2025 Conforming Loan Limits: What Middle Credit Score Borrowers Need to Know
item.description:
The Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA) has announced the 2025 conforming loan limits, bringing exciting opportunities for middle credit score borrowers seeking safe, government-backed financing through Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac programs.

What Are Conforming Loan Limits?

Conforming loan limits represent the maximum amount you can borrow through Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac programs while maintaining government-sponsored enterprise (GSE) backing. These limits ensure loans remain within the “conforming” category, offering borrowers enhanced security and standardized terms.
